title: Alternative to Copperplate
content:
My company is designing a identity package for a take-home supper company. We'd like to use a clean titling font with a little warmth. They like the idea of something that feels like Copperplate, but it's a bit too overused for our taste.

Any suggestions?
author: monolift

comments.content:
A take-home supper company in Copperplate ?  
Is it really overused for that purpose over there ?

Copperplate is overused for everything everywhere.

[Percival](http://web.archive.org/web/20150303172212/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/singles/creative_alliance/percival/)  
 [Sackers Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150303172212/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=sackers+gothic)  
 [Titling Gothic](http://web.archive.org/web/20150303172212/http:/www.fontshop.com/search/?q=titling%20gothic)  
 [Amerigo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150303172212/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/bitstream/bitstream_amerigo_ot/)  
 [Albertus](http://web.archive.org/web/20150303172212/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/monotype/albertus_std/)  
 [ITC Symbol](http://web.archive.org/web/20150303172212/http:/www.fontshop.com/fonts/downloads/itc/itc_symbol/)

I like Albertus (it's on my business card), but depending where you are, Friz Quadrata may well be overused -- it is here. :-(

What about [Poppl-Laudatio](http://web.archive.org/web/20150303172212/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/berthold/laudatio-be/) or [Tiepolo](http://web.archive.org/web/20150303172212/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/itc-tiepolo/)?

[Baker Signet](http://web.archive.org/web/20150303172212/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/adobe/baker-signet/) isn't a bad choice either, but it doesn't have an italic or bold....
Thanks all. Those are some great suggestions. ITC Symbol and Penumbra are really close I think.
